Deficiency Narrative: Three staff did not complete The Preventing and Recognizing Youth Sexual Abuse training, and Trauma Informed Care timely.  In addition, four staff did not complete Psychotropic Medication trainings with the 12 months of the previous training.
Correction Narrative:
RCCR received an email from the operation stating that all trainings are tracked within the case management system, extended reach, staff will receive an email when training are expiring in the next 30 days. Staff will complete this as soon as possible and provide a certificate with a date.
If its not completed by the next reminder which is in 15 days prior to expiration date they will get it done and provide the certificate, all efforts to complete will be documented by email, and failure to complete training will result in a write-up.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's 72-hour plan does not document information regarding the type of treatment services the child was admitted for, nor does it describe the goal of placement.
Correction Narrative: The operation terminated the staff member involved in the incident, the operation re-trained all remaining staff on non-violent crisis intervention and the preliminary service plan form was updated to include the type of services and goal of the placement.  The operation updated the remaining children currently placed at the operation service plans.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was prescribed a medication increase of 2 MG of Guanfacine 1 pill tablets on 7/25/2023. The child has 11 pills remaining at today's inspection.
During sleeping hours, a staff member was observed lying on the couch. A child in care crawled past the staff member and went into another child's room.
Correction Narrative: On 06/06/2023 the operation's plan for compliance was to implemented 2 motion sensors, 1 for each hallway to alert staff of any movement during the night. -Retraining on 24hr supervision policy occurred for de on 6/2 and ah on 6/3. -Working on hiring additional night staff. Owner Marissa Jubert will make random calls during overnight shifts to check in. Continue to do random pop up visits. On 06/29/2023 an inspection to the operation was conducted by RCCR and it was reported that staff have not been observed as sleeping on duty for the past two weeks. Random calls to the operation were conducted without concern.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of this investigation, it was determined a caregiver used pepper spray against a child as a response to the child's behavior.
Correction Narrative:
The operation submitted a plan to indicate that the employee involved in this investigation was  sent home and then terminated. The policies were 
were edited to include a wider range/more specific list of items listed as prohibited to avoid confusion in the future. All staff were retrained on de-escalation techniques and our weapons policy (see attached weapons policy, de-escalation policy). Safety plan was implemented to include new weapons policy. A poster of prohibited items was hung in the staff's office. The operation committed to completing self-checks with staff as a reminder to all staff not to have weapons on the property. New hires signed adherence to the policy.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used profane language with a child in care during an altercation.
Correction Narrative:
The child was reviewed and observed with no concerns, the child made no outcries and said he loves the operation. On 06/02/2023 the operation reported that discipline training, CPI training, and individualized child engagement training was completed to improve staff's competence. The operation will forward confirmation of these steps to RCCR for verification. The staff's case files will be updated for confirmation. Below are other techniques that can be used to de-escalate a situation:
Positive reinforcement is the most effective form of molding a behavior, and will be used first and in-conjunction with all other forms of behavior intervention.
Specific interventions allowed are described below:
Ignoring:  paying no obvious attention to the youths negative behavior, in order to extinguish the behavior from lack of attention.
Calm discussion:  listening to the youth to see if you can determine the source of the difficulty and help solve the problem.
Warning:  informing the youth of the unwanted behavior and of the possible consequences if the behavior continues.
Activity restriction:  a youth may be restricted from a specific activity for a specific period of time depending on the severity of the misbehavior.  
Quiet time:  allowing the youth at the youths own initiative to enter and remain in a designated area for a brief period, in order to regain control.
Verbal warning:  a warning may be given to a youth without further disciplinary action and will include the offense, expected behavior and the understanding that repetition of this behavior will result in further disciplinary action.
Loss of Level(s):  A youth may lose a single or more levels, depending on whether the incident was a major or a minor rule violation or the chronic repetition of the misbehavior.
Room restriction:  a youth may be restricted to his room for a specific period of time, the length of which depends on the nature of the misbehavior and the circumstances.  A restriction may not exceed one minute per year of the childs chronological or developmental age.  The reason for the room restriction will be explained to the youth before initiation of the restriction.
Early bedtime:  the youths scheduled bedtime may be reduced in one-hour units dependent on his behavior.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver did not use proper de-escalation techniques with a child in care and continued using profane or other language that escalated the altercation.
Correction Narrative:
The child was reviewed and observed with no concerns, the child made no outcries and said he loves the operation. On 06/02/2023 the operation reported that discipline training, CPI training, and individualized child engagement training was completed to improve staff's competence. The operation will forward confirmation of these steps to RCCR for verification. The staff's case files will be updated for confirmation. On 05/17/2023 the staff involved received CPI training. The portion of the training relevant to this standard is: Below are other techniques that can be used to de-escalate a situation:
Positive reinforcement is the most effective form of molding a behavior, and will be used first and in-conjunction with all other forms of behavior intervention.
Specific interventions allowed are described below:
Ignoring:  paying no obvious attention to the youths negative behavior, in order to extinguish the behavior from lack of attention.
Calm discussion:  listening to the youth to see if you can determine the source of the difficulty and help solve the problem.
Warning:  informing the youth of the unwanted behavior and of the possible consequences if the behavior continues.
Activity restriction:  a youth may be restricted from a specific activity for a specific period of time depending on the severity of the misbehavior.  
Quiet time:  allowing the youth at the youths own initiative to enter and remain in a designated area for a brief period, in order to regain control.
Verbal warning:  a warning may be given to a youth without further disciplinary action and will include the offense, expected behavior and the understanding that repetition of this behavior will result in further disciplinary action.
Loss of Level(s):  A youth may lose a single or more levels, depending on whether the incident was a major or a minor rule violation or the chronic repetition of the misbehavior.
Room restriction:  a youth may be restricted to his room for a specific period of time, the length of which depends on the nature of the misbehavior and the circumstances.  A restriction may not exceed one minute per year of the childs chronological or developmental age.  The reason for the room restriction will be explained to the youth before initiation of the restriction.
Early bedtime:  the youths scheduled bedtime may be reduced in one-hour units dependent on his behavior.

Correction Narrative: Two children that were previously placed in care did not recived a  trigger review  after  3 unathroized absences with a 60 day timeframe while in care in September 2022.

Deficiency Narrative: Two employees did not have their TB test results documented in their file during inspection.
Correction Narrative: The agency sent the two employees TB test results via email. These documents can be reviewed in agency file in SharePoint-digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, it was determined that the operation did not a resolution documented on the serious incident report.
Correction Narrative: On 3/9/2023 RCCR received the updated serious incident report from the operation, with the following resolution documented on the serious incident report. The safety plan was updated for the youth and staff monitored the youths interactions with other youth closely going forward.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was inappropriately restrained.
Correction Narrative: Staff member was retrained in correct restraint methods and practices on 09/16/2022. Verification provided from agency.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the six child files reviewed, four were recommended a PCP follow-up per their CANS Assessment but there was no  documentation to support that this was completed.
Correction Narrative: Case manager was retrained on maintaining records. Documentation of this is in the employee's file.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the six child files reviewed, three contained service plans that had the wrong effective and start dates documented.
Correction Narrative: Case manager was retrained on maintaining records. Documentation of this is in the employee's file.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan recommended that the child participate in grief therapy and this service is not being provided to the child. Another child's CANS assessment recommended the child see a Developmental Disability Specialist and this was not done.
Correction Narrative: This investigation trained agency staff of proper CANS follow ups. Staff are currently working with life path systems to make sure all requirements are met. All reviewed youth still in placement have been set up with case management and should begin other CANS recommended services soon.

Deficiency Narrative: Numerous medication logs did not have the year documented on the forms.
Correction Narrative: Staff have been notified to start documenting the year when documenting medication administration.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the six child files reviewed, three were not signed by the child.
Correction Narrative: Case manager was retrained on maintaining records. Documentation of this is in the employee's file.

Deficiency Narrative: Two serious incidents were not reported to Licensing.
Correction Narrative: The agency will report all substantial physical injuries including those that involve physical abuse committed by a child against another child as stated in minimum standards. The administrative team will continue to improve our assessments of substantial physical injury by communicating with the LCCA when an injury occurs to determine if and when to report a serious incident.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the six child files reviewed, one had a service plan team meeting invite that was sent out with less than two weeks notice.
Correction Narrative: The agency has created a spreadsheet to track due dates and dates needed to notify case workers. Extended reach also gives a 30-day notice that a service plan is due.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple windows in the facility had damaged and broken blinds.
Correction Narrative: Photos of new blinds installed were received.

Deficiency Narrative: In June 2021 a staff member violated his conditions of employment and the administrator placed the staff on disciplinary action. The disciplinary action stated the staff would be terminated if the staff violated conditions. In May 2022 the staff again violated the conditions of his employment and the administrator was made aware immediately. As of 06/13/2022 the staff is still present and employed at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The staff member who violated their conditions has been terminated as of 06/14/2022.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member transported children in care to the bus stop and this was against the staff member's conditions.
Correction Narrative:
As of 06/17/2022 the operation terminated Mr. Snowden's employment and has made his background check inactive.

On 06/13/2022 a follow-up inspection was conducted at the operation and the conditions were observed to be in compliance. 
A compliance plan/safety plan was received which stated the following: 
- Supervisor will ensure there are 2 other staff on a shift that includes this staff member as much as possible.
- The administrative team met with the staff member on 5/24/22 to review all provisions and ensure understanding across all parties.
- During this meeting, management created scenarios and role played how to properly handle issues while remaining compliant with provisions as a review for the staff member.
- During the staff meeting on 5/24/2022, management discussed with ALL staff what each provision means and how to remain in compliance when working with a coworker who is under any of those provisions. 
- Staff will sign this training to ensure understanding of provisions and how to remain compliant.
- All staff who are on provisions will also review and sign their paperwork as a reminder of their conditions

Deficiency Narrative: A staff members background conditions were not followed.
Correction Narrative: A staff training was conducted on provisions to ensure understanding from all parties.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver shoulder checked a child in care.
Correction Narrative: The staff member involved in this incident has been terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: There are holes in the walls of two rooms. One hole in the wall next to the entry way door. The second hole was on the bathroom door in a seperate bedroom. Blinds have been damaged as well.
Correction Narrative: All holes in walls and doors have been patched and window blinds have been replaced.

Deficiency Narrative: Child's file did not have a signature in "Child's Rights" section
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency which contained a compliance plan. The compliance plan stated the operation has added the Child's Rights form into their process to just print it and have it ready for all intakes in case the CPS worker forgets it.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's medication file was missing dosage.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency which contained a compliance plan. The compliance plan stated all staff have been retrained in medication error/protocol. All staff will also receive additional medication training when the operation moves over to electronic filing.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not report an incident to the hotline within appropriate time frame.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the facility. The email stated the staff member, as well as all other staff, have completed additional training on reporting serious incidents. A copy of the staff member's training certificate was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was seen being recorded on staff cell phone and the video assessible to others.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency containing a compliance plan which stated the following: management reviewed confidentiality paperwork and had each staff resign the form and placed it in each employee's file, meeting was conducted with staff where it was discussed that staff are not allowed to record the youth or have youth in the background of any personal videos or photos and that confidential information about youth is not to be shared on social media or with anyone not employed by the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was admitted in the program on 04/22/2021. At the time of admission the child was diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder.  The permit type does not offer services to handle the child's level of care. The service plan does not indicate services for emotional disorder.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency that contained a compliance plan which stated the agency reviewed minimum standards and their admission policies and determined youth in their care met all requirements to be admitted into our program and are receiving all required services. The agency accepted the youth referenced on the basis of his/her emotional disorders, the checkbox on the service plan was intended to be marked but was not. Each admission assessment is completed by members of the service team including our Treatment Director, the youths therapist, Case Manager, etc. This youth is receiving all treatment services available. In the future, the agency will submit a variance if a youth does not meet their admission policy.

Deficiency Narrative: CBCU notified the La Maison on 6-02-2021 that a caregiver may be present at the operation on a provisional basis.   On 7-26-2021 it was learned that the caregiver was present at the operation and had unsupervised contact with children in care and transported children.
A staff member's case file did not have a diploma or High school equivalency.
Correction Narrative:
The agency e-mailed a college transcript. 
In reference to the employee not having a high school diploma in their file, the employee made several efforts to contact his school overseas and eventually was able to get his transcripts sent. In the future we will have employees take the GED test as requested.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incedent reports did not include all names of the people restaining a child and the steps taken to deescalate the situation.
Correction Narrative: During a phone conversation with Robin H., stated that she will comply in the future by training her staff to be more detail oriented and change the EBI template to ensure that details are given.

Deficiency Narrative: A child did not receive their psychotropic  medication as prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Administrator Harbin reported the employee is no longer at the operation.  She provided additional training with employees on medication entries and she redid the medication instructions.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff members watched a child being abused by a caregiver and did not intervene.
Correction Narrative: Staff at all levels have been reminded of the importance of not only reporting incidents of this nature to their supervisor and the abuse neglect hotline, but also to intervene with protective actions on behalf of the youth if necessary. I have sent all staff several suggestions of how to intervene appropriately as well as how to manage their own behaviors in times of high tension. We will be reviewing the rights of youth in care next week at our staff meeting as well as effective communication strategies. In addition to those things, we have let the offending staff member/supervisor JT go; he is no longer employed at our operation. We have replaced him with a new staff supervisor. We have created a staff trainer position to train new hires. We have all new hires review youth rights during their preservice training in addition to their general pre service trainings on our policies and procedures We self-reported the allegations and will continue to do so to ensure our compliance with minimum standards and the health and safety of the youth in our care. We do not allow the use of threats, intimidation, or physical discomfort as a disciplinary measure.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member, while using profanity, threatened to harm a 10 year old child in care. This occurred while the child sat in a corner crying and shaking. After the incident the staff member continue the behavior by calling the childs parent a prostitute and a whore.
Correction Narrative: The operation obtained compliance by terminating an employee, retraining staff, and implementing a safety plan to ensure conditions of employment is followed. A follow up inspection was conducted by RCCR to ensure compliance and no concerns were found at the time of the inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member told a child in care to switch them with a television cord and see what will happen. Another staff member brought the television and placed it in front of the child.
Correction Narrative:
We have let the offending staff
member/supervisor go; he is no longer employed at our operation. We have replaced him with a new staff supervisor. We have created a staff trainer position to train new hires. We have all new hires review youth rights during their preservice training in addition to their general pre service trainings on our policies and procedures. We self-reported the allegations and will continue to do so to ensure our compliance with minimum standard and the health and safety of the youth in our care. We do not allow the use of threats, intimidation, or physical discomfort as a disciplinary measure.
